Sentencas: For decades, Ni based cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) have been suffering from poisoning from sulfur in fuel and carbon deposition while operating on hydrocarbon fuel.
Titulo: An ingenious Ni/Ce co-doped titanate based perovskite as a coking-tolerant anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Using perovskite as an alternative can effectively alleviate these problems.
Titulo: An ingenious Ni/Ce co-doped titanate based perovskite as a coking-tolerant anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells
An ingenious Ni/Ce co-doped titanate based perovskite as a coking-tolerant anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this work, a lanthanum strontium titanate based perovskite oxide with facile modification of Ni and Ce (LSCNT) was fabricated by a modified sol-gel method.
Titulo: An ingenious Ni/Ce co-doped titanate based perovskite as a coking-tolerant anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The exsolution of Ni surrounded by uniformly dispersed Ce species in the perovskite lattice could only be obtained by sintering the material in consecutive atmospheres of air and 10% H-2/Ar.
Titulo: An ingenious Ni/Ce co-doped titanate based perovskite as a coking-tolerant anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) equipped with an LSCNT anode exhibited desirable electrochemical performance and stability with 5000 pm H2S/H-2 and dry methane fuel.
Titulo: An ingenious Ni/Ce co-doped titanate based perovskite as a coking-tolerant anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The presence of exsolved metallic Ni provided strong active sites for the fuel oxidation reaction and simultaneously the Ce species with a redox couple provided Ni with abundant oxygen ions.
Titulo: An ingenious Ni/Ce co-doped titanate based perovskite as a coking-tolerant anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The synergetic effect between Ce and Ni facilitates the electrochemical reaction and promotes the removal of carbon deposition.
Titulo: An ingenious Ni/Ce co-doped titanate based perovskite as a coking-tolerant anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: All these features make LSCNT a promising sulfur and carbon-deposition tolerant anode material for SOFCs.
Titulo: An ingenious Ni/Ce co-doped titanate based perovskite as a coking-tolerant anode material for direct hydrocarbon solid oxide fuel cells
